de.mrapp.android.adapter.list

Class AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ViewHolder>
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter<AbsListView>, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, SortableListAdapter<DataType>, ListAdapter<DataType>, Loggable, RecyclerViewAdapter, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractListAdapter<DataType,DecoratorType>
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ViewHolder>
implements ListAdapter<DataType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The key, which is used to store the state of the view, the adapter has been attached to, within a bundle.

      The key, which is used to store, whether duplicate items should be allowed, or not, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String LOG_LEVEL_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the log level, which is used for logging, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String NOTIFY_ON_CHANGE_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store, whether the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be called automatically when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, or not, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String PARAMETERS_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the key value pairs, which are stored within the adapter, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String PARCELABLE_ITEMS_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the adapter's underlying data within a bundle, if it implements the interface Parcelable.
      protected static java.lang.String SERIALIZABLE_ITEMS_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the adapter's underlying data within a bundle, if it implements the interface Serializable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractListAdapter

        protected AbstractListAdapter(Context context,
                              Inflater inflater,
                              DecoratorType decorator,
                              LogLevel logLevel,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Item<DataType>> items,
                              boolean allowDuplicates,
                              boolean notifyOnChange,
                              java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemClickListener<DataType>> itemClickListeners,
                              java.util.Set<ListAdapterItemLongClickListener<DataType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                              java.util.Set<ListAdapterListener<DataType>> adapterListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        inflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the views, which are used to visualize the adapter's items, as an instance of the type Inflater. The inflater may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        items - A list, which contains the adapter's items, or an empty list, if the adapter should not contain any items
        allowDuplicates - True, if duplicate items should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

        public final java.util.List<DataType> subList(int start,
                                              int end)
        Description copied from interface: ListAdapter
        Returns a list, which contains the adapter's items between a specific start and end index.
        Specified by:
        subList in interface ListAdapter<DataType>
        Parameters:
        start - The start index of the items, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The item, which belongs to the start index will be included. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        end - The end index of the items, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The item, which belongs to the end index, will be excluded. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int -1 and it must be greater than the start index, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the adapter's items, between a specific start end end index, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter does not contain any items

      • toArray

        public final <T> T[] toArray(T[] array)
        Description copied from interface: ListAdapter
        Returns an array, which contains all of the adapter's items. If the given array is large enough to hold the items, the specified array is used, otherwise an array of the same type is created. If the given array can hold more items, the array's elements, following the adapter's items, are set to null.
        Specified by:
        toArray in interface ListAdapter<DataType>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array, which should be returned
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An array, which contains all of the adapter's items, as an array of the generic type T or an empty array, if the adapter does not contain any items
